items.title: PowerPoint file corrupted when solidify cell (from table) background color
items.body:
``` python
from pptx.dml.color import RGBColor

# cell is a table cell
# set fill type to solid color first
cell.fill.solid()

# set foreground (fill) color to a specific RGB color
cell.fill.fore_color.rgb = RGBColor(0xFB, 0x8F, 0x00)
```

_Originally posted by @scanny in https://github.com/scanny/python-pptx/issues/52#issuecomment-30950807_ 

When I was applying FillFormat.solid(), the application finds the saved .pptx as problematic and force to repair it. If repaired, the required cell (of the table) fill format was initialised to default, that is empty cell. While if not repaired, the application is closed automatically.

items.title: Unable to copy RGBColor objects
items.body:
I'm trying to copy/deepcopy an object that contains RGBColor objects. However RGBColor raises an exception when trying to copy since the class can't be pickled/unpickled
```
from copy import deepcopy
from pptx.dml.color import RGBColor
color = RGBColor(255, 255, 255)
deepcopy(color)
```
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/Users/saleh/Git/app2/env/lib/python3.6/copy.py", line 180, in deepcopy
    y = _reconstruct(x, memo, *rv)
  File "/Users/saleh/Git/app2/env/lib/python3.6/copy.py", line 274, in _reconstruct
    y = func(*args)
  File "/Users/saleh/Git/app2/env/lib/python3.6/copyreg.py", line 88, in __newobj__
    return cls.__new__(cls, *args)
TypeError: __new__() missing 2 required positional arguments: 'g' and 'b'

__new__() missing 2 required positional arguments: 'g' and 'b'
```

I solved it by defining a `__getnewargs__` function for the RGB class. If yall think this is a good addition to python-pptx, I can make a pr for it.
```
class RGBColor(RGBColor):
	# enables copy
	def __getnewargs__(self):
		return (*self, )
```

items.body:

```

    from collections import Sequence
```

This issue was found when running pytest on some code that imports the python-pptx module.

I have searched around to see if others have brought this up. I did not find any other mentions of this issue related to python-pptx, however it is mentioned a lot with other python modules.

ex: scikit learn -> https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/11121

Hope this helps for future development, I find this to be a very useful module.

Keep up the good work, Thanks!

items.title: Is it possible to remove all the lines in a graph using this library in creating a clustered bar graph?
bar chart colors when there is only one series
items.body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1678394/52985498-63bedb80-33f4-11e9-9794-19be864a9322.png)

Bar chart coloring works properly when there are several series but when there is only one, it uses different colors for the same series' items.

I want to use same color for the top chart above. 
I'm not sure if it's a bug or feature :)

Example code:
```
from pptx import Presentation
from pptx.slide import Slide
from pptx.chart.data import ChartData
from pptx.enum.chart import XL_CHART_TYPE
from pptx.enum.chart import XL_LEGEND_POSITION
from pptx.util import Cm

prs = Presentation()
slide_layout = prs.slide_layouts[6]

slide = prs.slides.add_slide(slide_layout)
shapes = slide.shapes

x_axis_values = ['a', 'b', 'c']
data_1 = {
    'series_1': [3, 4, 5]
}
data_2 = {
    'series_1': [3, 4, 5],
    'series_2': [4, 5, 6]
}

chart_data_1 = ChartData()
chart_data_1.categories = x_axis_values
for label, values in data_1.items():
    chart_data_1.add_series(label, values)

chart_data_2 = ChartData()
chart_data_2.categories = x_axis_values
for label, values in data_2.items():
    chart_data_2.add_series(label, values)

chart_1 = shapes.add_chart(
    chart_type = XL_CHART_TYPE.COLUMN_CLUSTERED,
    chart_data = chart_data_1,
    x= Cm(1.5), y= Cm(1), cx= Cm(20), cy= Cm(8.5)
).chart

chart_2 = shapes.add_chart(
    chart_type = XL_CHART_TYPE.COLUMN_CLUSTERED,
    chart_data = chart_data_2,
    x= Cm(1.5), y= Cm(9.5), cx= Cm(20), cy= Cm(8.5)
).chart
```

items.title: Creating slides based on layout, how to obtain the layout's placeholder text
items.body:
I'm creating a Python program to create a few hundred slides from a datasource. Each record in that datasource will result in about 6 slides. I have created a bunch of layout slides as the template for each record. In the placeholders I created in the layout sides, I placed text such as "{givenName}". My intention was that when creating a slide based on a layout, I would then use Python string templating to merge in the values from each record. Unfortunately I can't seem to figure out how to determine which layout placeholder shape is linked to which shape on the derived slides.

I know that `slide.slide_layout.placeholders` gives me the placeholder shapes that were in the layout, and I can get the text value of each of those easily enough. These text values do contain what I expect. The problem comes, when I iterate through slide.placeholders, I can't seem to find any attribute that tells me which of the slide_layout.placeholders that particular shape is based off. I've tried going several items deep in the various attributes can't can't seem to find the way to link the two bits together.

Looking at shape_id's doesn't seem to help. As an example, in one slide the slide.layout.placeholders have shape_id's of 6, 7, 8, 12 where as the slide.shapes.shape_id's are 3, 4, 5, 2. There doesn't seem to be any attribute that provides the link. I even tried just going in sequential order of iteration but that didn't work correctly either.

I've spent hours experimenting with different options and navigating the api documentation to no avail. Any assistance would be greatly appreciated!

items.title: feature: Chart.font

A chart has an XML element where a default font can be specified:  
`c:chartSpace/c:txPr/a:p/a:pPr/a:defRPr`

Setting certain font attributes such as size and color at the chart level can greatly reduce the piece-wise changes required when the default 18pt Text1 font is not suitable.

items.title: best_fit_font_size unexpected behaviour
items.body:
I'm trying to find out whether or not a text will fit into a shape. What I'm doing is basically creating a rectangle, adding some text to its TextFrame, and using `TextFitter.best_fit_font_size` to find out whether or not the text fits. If the returned font size is smaller than my max size (which also happens to be the font size of the text), I know that the shape is too small to fit the text.

However, the function is not at all behaving like I expected. Here's an example:
<details><summary> Code </summary>

```python
from pptx import Presentation
from pptx.enum.shapes import MSO_SHAPE
from pptx.enum.text import MSO_ANCHOR, PP_ALIGN
from pptx.util import Cm, Pt
from pptx.text.layout import TextFitter
from pptx.text.fonts import FontFiles
from pptx.dml.color import RGBColor

def create_box(slide, left, top, width, height, items):
    box = slide.shapes.add_shape(MSO_SHAPE.RECTANGLE, left, top, width, height)
    box.shadow.inherit = False
    box.fill.solid()
    box.fill.fore_color.rgb = box.line.color.rgb = RGBColor(230, 230, 230)
    frame = box.text_frame
    frame.vertical_anchor = MSO_ANCHOR.TOP
    frame.word_wrap = True

    first = True
    for item in items:
        if first:
            p = frame.paragraphs[0]
            p.alignment = PP_ALIGN.LEFT
            first = False
        else:
            p = frame.add_paragraph()

        r = p.add_run()
        r.text = '- ' + item

        r.font.size = Pt(12)
        r.font.color.rgb = RGBColor(0, 0, 0)

    font_file = FontFiles.find('Calibri', False, False)
    fit = TextFitter.best_fit_font_size(frame.text, frame._extents, 12, font_file)
    print('best fit: %d' % fit)

def main():
    prs = Presentation()

    # make widescreen (16:9)
    prs.slide_width = Cm(33.867)
    prs.slide_height = Cm(19.05)

    slide_layout = prs.slide_layouts[6]
    slide = prs.slides.add_slide(slide_layout)

    create_box(slide, Cm(2), Cm(2), Cm(5), Cm(9), ['test'])
    create_box(slide, Cm(8), Cm(2), Cm(5), Cm(2), ['test', 'abc', '123', 'testing', 'some long line that will probably overflow'])

    prs.save("pres.pptx")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
```
</details>

---

This gives the following result in PowerPoint:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1276064/44851653-56a10b00-ac61-11e8-814a-2d226ebbcd2a.png)

It's immediately apparent that the box on the right overflows quite significantly. However, `best_fit_font_size` gives the result `12` every time. I don't know if I'm missing something, but as I see it the second value should definitely be something lower (like 10).

If I raise the `max_size` to something higher (say, 20), the results are equally as confusing. It returns `20` for the leftmost box (this is expected, since the box is clearly big enough to fit that size), but `13` for the rightmost box. This doesn't make any sense, because the algorithm seems to make the font size even bigger than it already is, despite the fact that the container is already way too small in the first place.

Any ideas?

items.title: Category Axis, Value Axis Tick Label Position not assigned properly
items.body:
I think I found an issue with setting axis tick label position. The resulting XML shows the tickLblPos as "nextTo" instead of "low". (This is a stacked column chart with positive and negative values, so the category axis labels need to be beneath the plot area, not alongside/next to the axis line.)

```
      <c:catAx>
        <c:axId val="-2068027336"/>
        <c:scaling>
          <c:orientation val="minMax"/>
        </c:scaling>
        <c:delete val="0"/>
        <c:axPos val="b"/>
        <c:majorTickMark val="out"/>
        <c:minorTickMark val="none"/>
        <c:tickLblPos val="nextTo"/>
```

I'm formatting the chart with this method:

```
def format_chart(t, chart):
    """
        applies some default formatting to the chart
        t is a DimTable object which is not currently used
        , but we may leverage that in thefuture to do conditional formatting.
    """
    plot = chart.plots[0]
    # by default, a chart with single series will vary color per category. 
    #plot.vary_by_categories = False 
    plot.has_data_labels = True
    set_label_position(t, chart)
    if t.custom_properties['showNegativeLabelsAsPositive']:
        override_negative_value_labels(t, chart)

    set_label_font_format(plot.data_labels, False, 14, MSO_THEME_COLOR_INDEX.TEXT_1)
    set_series_overlap(t, chart)

    category_axis = chart.category_axis
    set_axis_line_format(category_axis, False, MSO_THEME_COLOR_INDEX.BACKGROUND_2)
    set_label_font_format(category_axis.tick_labels, False, 14, MSO_THEME_COLOR_INDEX.TEXT_1)
    if t.custom_properties['categoryAxisLabelPosition']:
        category_axis.tick_labels.position = t.custom_properties['categoryAxisLabelPosition']

    value_axis = chart.value_axis
    set_axis_line_format(value_axis, True, MSO_THEME_COLOR_INDEX.BACKGROUND_2)
    set_label_font_format(value_axis.tick_labels, False, 14, MSO_THEME_COLOR_INDEX.BACKGROUND_2)
    value_axis.visible = not t.custom_properties['hideValueAxis']

```

the `t.custom_properties` is a `defaultdict(bool)` and assigned in another class, using the enumeration:

       self.Tables[4].custom_properties['categoryAxisLabelPosition'] = XL_TICK_LABEL_POSITION.LOW

If I manually edit that node in the XML to "low" instead of "nextTo", then the axis tick labels appear correctly. 

I believe this also affects the `value_axis`, though I did not test it as thoroughly in that regard. 



**I am able to do this with a workaround function:**

```
def set_axis_tick_label_position(xpath, position, chart):
    """
    Workaround function to assign tick label position to category or value axis.
    xpath: an x-path specification for the axis' tick labels
    position: an XL_TICK_LABEL_POSITION 
    chart: a chart object

    This function accesses the element specified by xpath and assigns the appropriate attribute value based 
    on the XL_TICK_LABEL_POSITION
    
    We should be able to assign directly, but for at least some charts, the output XML has "nextTo" (default) instead of the specified position

        chart.category_axis.tick_labels.position = t.custom_properties['categoryAxisLabelPosition']
        

    """
    ele = chart._chartSpace.xpath(xpath)[0]
    val = "nextTo" # default
    if position == XL_TICK_LABEL_POSITION.LOW:
        val = "low"
    if position == XL_TICK_LABEL_POSITION.HIGH:
        val = "high"
    if position == XL_TICK_LABEL_POSITION.NONE:
        val = "none"
    ele.set("val", val)
```

items.title: Updating Shape Element XML
items.body:
I was looking to update the text for Merged Shapes or CT_GroupShape and found that there was no easy way to do this. I have traversed the XML tree of the shape and have updated the text in the tree structure. Although, I do not see a way to update the corresponding ._element.xml object that will result in the change in the original slide. 

```
for sld in prs.slides:
      for shp in sld.shapes:
               new_tree = UpdateXMLFunction(shp._element.xml)

               new_tree = serialize_for_reading(new_tree) ??
               shp._element = new_tree ??

```

It looks like the BaseOxmlElement classes work in sert data into childs. How should we be updated the xml trees for these objects? Or is there an easier to update the text in grouped shape files other than going through the XMLs. Any help would be appreciated, thanks.

items.title: Add Bullet list using python-pptx
items.body:
I am using the python-pptx library for pptx manipulation. I want to add a bullet list in the pptx document. 

I am using the following snippet to add list item:

    p = text_frame.add_paragraph()
    run = p.add_run()
    p.level = 0
    run.text = "First"

But it does not display bullet points. Please guide.

Quick response will be appreciated.

items.title: Add a image in table cell using python-pptx
items.body:
I am using the python-pptx library to create a table in pptx document. I want to add an image in the table cell, but I haven't found such option to do so.

I am adding cell using following code:

table.cell(0, 1).text = 'cell text'

Please help me how we can add an image in a table cell using python-pptx.

Quick response will be appreciated.

items.title: TextFrame.fit_text() -> TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable
items.body: There is an issue where if a string without spaces that is in the text frame is too long, a TypeError would be raised. Shouldn't the font size of the text just be decreased until the text fit in the frame?

items.title: Add_Picture with Links
items.body:
Hi, wondering if there is a way add_picture() can support links to images in cloud storage, rather than a local path?  I'm deploying an app that uses pptx and want to be able to store the static files elsewhere.  Currently receiving FileNotFoundError when linking to an image: 

`prs = Presentation('...')
	
blank_slide_layout = prs.slide_layouts[0]
slide = prs.slides.add_slide(blank_slide_layout)

img_path = '...' #link to image in cloud storage, also tried with links to images on public sites

#image placement
left = Inches(0.25)
top = Inches(1.4)
height = Inches(4.06)

pic = slide.shapes.add_picture(img_path, left, top, height=height)`
